name: Jennifer G. Kim
content: Jennifer G. Kim Jennifer Gahee Kim Assistant Professor at Georgia Institute of Technology Contact: jennifer.kim [at] cc.gatech.edu | Office: CODA1578B Pronouns: She/her I obtained my Ph.D. from the Department of Computer Science speicialized in Human-Computer Intearction at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. I was advised by Dr. Karrie Karahalios, as part of the Social Spaces Group. I received my M.S. degree from Georgia Tech where I worked with Dr. Gregory Abowd and Dr. Rosa Arriaga. My research interests are in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and Computer-Supported Collaborative Work (CSCW), with a focus on health and wellbeing. My work understands, designs, and evaluates social and health information systems to promote advocacy and empathy. Please see my projects and publications and to learn more about my research. News 08/2025 | Our LLM job coach project, in collaboration with Prof. Mark Riedl's lab has been funded by NSF! O7/2025 | Kaely will be prersenting our work on uncovering Human-AI misalignment in job-Seeking support for neurodivergent users at ASSETS 2025! 06/2025 | Our LLM chatbot project for eating disorder recovery, in collaboration with Prof. Sung-ju Lee's lab at KAIST has received an Honorable Mention Award at CHI! 01/2025 | Two papers on Chatbot Support for Balanced Neurodiverse Social Interactions and on LLM Chatbot Support for Eatidng Disorder Recovery have been accepted to CHI 2025! 10/2024 | Georgia Tech (PIs: Prof. Sehoon Ha and me) is leading a $7M research project in collaboration with Neuromeka, ETRI, and KAIST to develop a mobile humanoid: News Students PhD students: Rachel Lowy, Kaely Hall, Seungwan Jin, Hyesoo Park MS students: Yeonsoo Chang, Alejandra Bernabel, Ethan Sylvia BS students: Korina Goldsmith, Aakrishtaa Kumar, Tanisha Paryani, Veena Gonugondla Classes CS 4803 & 8803: Personal Health Informatics | Spring 2021, Fall 2021, Spring 2022, Fall 2022 CS 6750: Human-Computer Interaction | Spring 2023 CS 3751: Introduction to UI Design | Spring 2024, Spring 2025, Fall 2025 Selected Publications | Google Scholar Understanding Human-AI Misalignment in LLM-Based Job-Seeking Support for Neurodivergent Users | Upcoming Kaely Hall, Marcus Ma, Xinyue Zhang, Vedant Das Swain Jennifer G Kim | ASSETS 2025 Working Together Toward Interdependence: Chatbot-based Support for Balanced Social Interactions Between Neurodivergent and Neurotypical Individuals | PDF Ha-Kyung Kong, Rachel Lowy, Youjin Choi, Jennifer G Kim | CHI 2025 Private Yet Social: How LLM Chatbots Support and Challenge Eating Disorder Recovery. | PDF (Honorable Mention) Ryuhaerang Choi, Taehan Kim, Subin Park, Jennifer G Kim, Sung-ju Lee | CHI 2025 More Understanding or More Burden?
